question:
Governments should spend money on railways rather than roads.
To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

The main reason why I believe that countries should build more railways is that it will decrease the traffic. Therefore, when the total number of cars go to the hald this means the traffic will go to the half which it will open a space for police, hospital's car, and firemen. The second reason why I think that authorities have to build trains instead of streets is because of its economics. Moreover, people will not go to their work by car; hence, they will use trains. This means that governments could allocate the spending of construction into such as health, education, etc. Secondly, economically speaking, the dangers of climate change has been lost the job of %8 of the world.
